headline: 2 GOP frontrunners in the Ohio Senate race squared off during a heated debate moment: 'You watch what happens'
author: Kelsey Vlamis
sentences: "He doesn't have the temperament, experience, or fortitude to be a US Senator and Ohio voters got a first-hand look at just how unprepared Josh Mandel has become and that will be reflected on the ballot on May 3," she added.
Video of the debate showed Josh Mandel, former Ohio state treasurer, stand up and get in the face of Mike Gibbons, an investment banker, while trying to confront him about an investment.
"Two tours in Iraq, don't tell me I haven't worked," Mandel, a Marine Corps veteran, said as he got nose-to-nose with Gibbons, who can be heard saying "you don't know squat."

Two leading candidates in the Republican primary for the US Senate race in Ohio squared off during a heated exchange at a debate on Friday evening in Columbus, Ohio.
Mike Gibbons (L) and Josh Mandel exchange heated arguments at the FreedomWorks Forum for Ohio's Republican Senate Candidates on March 18, 2022 in Columbus, Ohio.
"I think the way you used the US Marine Corps, Josh, is disgraceful," Vance, also a Marine Corps veteran, said, prompting applause from the audience.

—Heartland Signal (@HeartlandSignal) March 18, 2022
During the exchange, the crowd can be heard booing as both men tell each other to back off.
The debate was attended by other GOP primary candidates JD Vance, Matt Dolan, and Jane Timken, who looked on as the exchange unfolded.
Mandel stood up as Gibbons told him "you may not understand this" because "you've never been in the private sector your entire life."

He is only a professional at one thing: running for office," Samantha Cotten, a spokesperson for Gibbons, said.

Andrew Spear/Getty Images
Mike Gibbons and Josh Mandel got face-to-face on the debate stage Friday evening.
Vance commented on the exchange during the debate, taking aim at Mandel's comment about his service.
Video of the exchange showed the men telling each other to back off as other candidates watched.
In a statement provided to Insider, Gibbons denounced Mandel's "physically aggressive actions."
Mandel and his campaign did not immediately respond to Insider's request for comments.
When asked about the word "pussy," she said Gibbons was not the one to use that word.
The word "pussy" can also be heard, but it's not clear in the clip who said it.

"Josh Mandel is unhinged, unfit, and flailing - because he's losing.

Mandel can be heard saying: "You watch what happens."
